meanings.definition: A condition in which an abnormal amount of cerebrospinal fluid accumulates in the brain, typically causing enlargement of the head and pressure on the brain.
meanings.sent1: The baby's hydrocephaly led to a visibly larger head size.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed the patient with hydrocephaly after noticing the increased pressure in the brain.
meanings.sent3: The hydrocephaly in the brain made the child's head look like a balloon.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed freely, like the cerebrospinal fluid in hydrocephaly.
meanings.sent5: The hydrocephaly condition was as heavy as a weight pressing on the brain.
